CREATURE.name: ghosts
CREATURE.description: Pearly-white and slightly transparent, they glided across the room talking to each other

CREATURE.name: three-headed dog
CREATURE.description: A dog which filled the whole space between ceiling and floor. It had three heads.
CREATURE.significance: Guarded the trapdoor to the Philosopher's Stone

CREATURE.name: troll
CREATURE.description: Twelve feet tall, its skin was a dull, granite grey, its great lumpy body like a boulder with its small bald head perched on top like a coconut.
CREATURE.significance: Attacked Hermione in the girls' toilets

CREATURE.name: centaur
CREATURE.description: A being with the upper body of a human and the lower body of a horse.

CREATURE.name: werewolves
CREATURE.description: Human-like creatures that transform into wolves
CREATURE.significance: Mentioned as a possible threat in the Forbidden Forest

CREATURE.name: unicorn
CREATURE.description: A creature with a horse's body and a single horn on its forehead.
CREATURE.significance: Hunted for its blood in the Forbidden Forest

CREATURE.name: goblins
CREATURE.description: Swarthy, clever-faced creatures with pointed beards and long fingers and feet.

CREATURE.name: dragons
CREATURE.significance: Mentioned as a creature of interest to Hagrid and Charlie Weasley

CREATURE.name: boa constrictor
CREATURE.significance: Spoke to Harry at the zoo

CREATURE.description: A spirit of a dead person

CHAPTER.title: The Boy Who Lived
CHAPTER.summary: Harry Potter, an ordinary boy, discovers he is a wizard and learns about his parents' death at the hands of Lord Voldemort. He is taken to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, where he encounters a three-headed dog guarding a room and hears about a mysterious stone with incredible powers.

CHAPTER.title: The Vanishing Glass
CHAPTER.summary: Harry lives with the Dursleys, who treat him poorly. He is reminded of his parents' death and the scar on his forehead. Strange events occur around him, and he is taken to the zoo for Dudley's birthday, where he discovers he can communicate with a snake. The chapter ends with Harry being punished for the snake incident.

CHAPTER.title: The Letters from No One
CHAPTER.summary: Harry receives a letter from Hogwarts, but his uncle, Vernon, tries to prevent him from getting it. More letters arrive, and the Dursleys try to escape them, but the letters find them. Harry learns he is a wizard and is going to Hogwarts.

CHAPTER.title: The Keeper of the Keys
CHAPTER.summary: Hagrid arrives to take Harry to Hogwarts. He reveals Harry's parents were wizards and that Harry is famous for surviving Voldemort's attack. Hagrid gives Harry a birthday cake and tells him about the wizarding world, including Gringotts, the wizarding bank.

CHAPTER.title: Diagon Alley
CHAPTER.summary: Harry and Hagrid go to Diagon Alley to buy school supplies. Harry learns about wizarding currency, visits Gringotts, and buys his wand from Ollivander. He meets Draco Malfoy and gets an owl named Hedwig.

CHAPTER.title: The Journey from Platform Nine and Three-Quarters
CHAPTER.summary: Harry struggles to get to Platform 9 3/4 at King's Cross Station. He meets the Weasley family and boards the Hogwarts Express. He befriends Ron Weasley and meets Hermione Granger. They discuss their families and the wizarding world.

CHAPTER.title: The Sorting Hat
CHAPTER.summary: The first-years are sorted into their Hogwarts houses. Harry is sorted into Gryffindor. He meets his new housemates and attends the welcoming feast.

CHAPTER.title: The Potions Master
CHAPTER.summary: Harry has his first Potions lesson with Professor Snape, who dislikes him. He struggles with the subject and loses points for Gryffindor. Harry learns about the Gringotts break-in and suspects Snape is involved.

CHAPTER.title: The Midnight Duel
CHAPTER.summary: Harry learns he is on the Quidditch team as a Seeker. He and Ron are challenged to a wizard's duel by Malfoy. They are caught out of bed by Filch, and Hermione helps them escape. They encounter a three-headed dog guarding a trapdoor.

CHAPTER.title: Hallowe'en
CHAPTER.summary: Harry receives a new broomstick. He learns about the Philosopher's Stone and Nicolas Flamel. During the Hallowe'en feast, Professor Quirrell faints, and Harry, Ron, and Hermione realize Snape is trying to steal the Stone. They are caught out of bed again and lose points.

CHAPTER.title: Quidditch
CHAPTER.summary: Harry begins Quidditch training. He learns the rules and practices. He suspects Snape is jinxing his broom. During the match against Slytherin, Harry catches the Snitch, but Gryffindor loses points due to their actions.

CHAPTER.title: The Mirror of Erised
CHAPTER.summary: Harry finds the Mirror of Erised, which shows him his family. Dumbledore explains the mirror's purpose and warns him against dwelling on dreams. Harry, Ron, and Hermione discover Nicolas Flamel is the creator of the Philosopher's Stone.

CHAPTER.title: Nicolas Flamel
CHAPTER.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione search for information about Nicolas Flamel. They learn Hagrid's secret about Fluffy and suspect Snape is trying to steal the Stone. They discover Hagrid's dragon egg.

CHAPTER.title: The Forbidden Forest
CHAPTER.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione are given detention in the Forbidden Forest. They encounter centaurs and learn about the dangers of the Forest. They witness a hooded figure drinking unicorn blood, and Harry is saved by Firenze.

CHAPTER.title: Through the Trapdoor
CHAPTER.summary: Harry, Ron, and Hermione realize Snape is trying to steal the Stone. They decide to go through the trapdoor to stop him. They face various challenges, including Devil's Snare, enchanted keys, and a giant chessboard.

CHAPTER.title: The Man with Two Faces
CHAPTER.summary: Harry faces Quirrell, who reveals he is working for Voldemort. Harry learns Voldemort is using Quirrell to get the Stone. Harry confronts Voldemort, who tries to persuade him to join him. Harry touches Quirrell, causing him pain, and faints. He wakes up in the hospital wing and learns the Stone has been destroyed.

LOCATION.name: Privet Drive
LOCATION.description: Privet Drive is a street where the Dursleys live. It is described as being perfectly normal and ordinary. The Dursleys' house is at number four, and Harry Potter lives there for a decade.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry lives with the Dursleys and where he receives the letter that reveals his wizarding heritage.

LOCATION.name: Hogwarts
LOCATION.description: Hogwarts is a school of witchcraft and wizardry. It is a vast castle with many turrets and towers. It is the place where Harry and his friends learn magic and have many adventures.
LOCATION.significance: It is the primary setting for the story, where Harry attends school and learns about the wizarding world.

LOCATION.name: Diagon Alley
LOCATION.description: Diagon Alley is a cobbled street in London where wizards and witches can buy their supplies. It is full of shops selling robes, wands, and other magical items.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry buys his school supplies and first experiences the wizarding world.

LOCATION.name: The Leaky Cauldron
LOCATION.description: The Leaky Cauldron is a tiny, grubby-looking pub in London. It serves as a gateway to Diagon Alley.
LOCATION.significance: It is the entrance to Diagon Alley and a meeting place for wizards and witches.

LOCATION.name: Gringotts
LOCATION.description: Gringotts is a bank run by goblins. It is located miles beneath London and is considered the safest place in the world for anything you want to keep safe.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry keeps his money and where the Philosopher's Stone is initially stored.

LOCATION.name: Forbidden Forest
LOCATION.description: The Forbidden Forest is a dark and dangerous forest on the grounds of Hogwarts. It is forbidden to students.
LOCATION.significance: It is the location of several key events, including Harry's encounter with Voldemort and the death of the unicorn.

LOCATION.name: Gryffindor common room
LOCATION.description: The Gryffindor common room is a cosy, round room full of squashy armchairs. It is located in one of the towers of Hogwarts.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry, Ron, and Hermione spend their free time and where they discuss their adventures.

LOCATION.name: Hospital Wing
LOCATION.description: The hospital wing is where students go when they are injured or ill. It is run by Madam Pomfrey.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry recovers after his encounters with Quirrell and Voldemort.

LOCATION.name: The Great Hall
LOCATION.description: The Great Hall is a large hall in Hogwarts where students eat their meals and where important events, such as the Sorting Ceremony and the end-of-year feast, take place.
LOCATION.significance: It is a central location for school events and meals.

LOCATION.name: The Chamber of Secrets
LOCATION.description: The Chamber of Secrets is a secret chamber in Hogwarts. It is located on the third floor and is guarded by a three-headed dog.
LOCATION.significance: It is where the Philosopher's Stone is hidden.

LOCATION.name: The Astronomy Tower
LOCATION.description: The Astronomy Tower is the tallest tower in Hogwarts. It is out-of-bounds except for classes.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry and his friends are caught by Filch and Professor McGonagall.

LOCATION.name: The Trophy Room
LOCATION.description: The Trophy Room is a room in Hogwarts where trophies are displayed. It is where Harry and his friends are caught by Filch.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry and his friends are caught by Filch.

LOCATION.name: The Entrance Hall
LOCATION.description: The Entrance Hall is the main entrance to Hogwarts. It is where the Sorting Ceremony takes place.
LOCATION.significance: It is a central location for school events.

LOCATION.name: The Dungeons
LOCATION.description: The Dungeons are located in Hogwarts. It is where Potions lessons take place.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Potions lessons take place.

LOCATION.name: The Owl Emporium
LOCATION.description: The Owl Emporium is a shop in Diagon Alley that sells owls.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry buys his owl, Hedwig.

LOCATION.name: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions
LOCATION.description: Madam Malkin's Robes for All Occasions is a shop in Diagon Alley that sells robes.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry meets Draco Malfoy.

LOCATION.name: Flourish and Blotts
LOCATION.description: Flourish and Blotts is a shop in Diagon Alley that sells books.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry buys his school books.

LOCATION.name: The Apothecary
LOCATION.description: The Apothecary is a shop in Diagon Alley that sells potion ingredients.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry buys potion ingredients.

LOCATION.name: Ollivanders
LOCATION.description: Ollivanders is a shop in Diagon Alley that sells wands.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry buys his wand.

LOCATION.name: Cokeworth
LOCATION.description: Cokeworth is a town where Harry receives a letter.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry receives a letter.

LOCATION.name: Isle of Wight
LOCATION.description: The Isle of Wight is an island where Uncle Vernon's sister Marge is holidaying.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Uncle Vernon's sister Marge is holidaying.

LOCATION.description: London is a city where Harry goes to buy school supplies.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry goes to buy school supplies.

LOCATION.significance: It is where the boa constrictor in the zoo is from.

LOCATION.description: The Black Forest is a forest where Professor Quirrell met vampires.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Professor Quirrell met vampires.

LOCATION.name: Devon
LOCATION.description: Devon is a county where Nicolas Flamel lives.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Nicolas Flamel lives.

LOCATION.name: Blackpool pier
LOCATION.description: Blackpool pier is where Neville's great-uncle Algie pushed him off.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Neville's great-uncle Algie pushed him off.

LOCATION.name: The Hog's Head
LOCATION.description: The Hog's Head is a pub in the village.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Hagrid met the stranger.

LOCATION.name: The owlery
LOCATION.description: The owlery is where the school owls live.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Hedwig sleeps.

LOCATION.name: The Leaky Cauldron
LOCATION.description: The Leaky Cauldron is a pub in London.
LOCATION.significance: It is where Harry meets Professor Quirrell.

CONCEPT.name: Magic
CONCEPT.description: A supernatural force that permeates the world, enabling wizards and witches to perform extraordinary feats. It is the central element of the narrative, driving the plot and shaping the characters' lives.

CONCEPT.name: Wizards and Witches
CONCEPT.description: Individuals with the ability to wield magic. They are the primary actors in the story, with their actions and choices shaping the events of the narrative. They are set apart from Muggles, who lack magical abilities.

CONCEPT.name: Muggles
CONCEPT.description: Non-magical people who are unaware of the wizarding world. They represent the ordinary world, contrasting with the extraordinary world of magic. The wizarding world seeks to remain hidden from them.

CONCEPT.name: Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry
CONCEPT.description: A school for young witches and wizards, where they learn to control and use their magical abilities. It serves as a central setting for the story, providing a place for the characters to grow, learn, and face challenges.

CONCEPT.name: The Philosopher's Stone
CONCEPT.description: A legendary substance with the power to turn any metal into gold and produce the Elixir of Life, which grants immortality. It is a central plot device, sought after by those who desire its power.

CONCEPT.name: The Invisibility Cloak
CONCEPT.description: A magical artifact that renders the wearer invisible. It is a symbol of protection and secrecy, and it plays a crucial role in the characters' adventures.

CONCEPT.name: The Mirror of Erised
CONCEPT.description: A magical mirror that shows the viewer their deepest desires. It represents the allure of dreams and the dangers of dwelling on them instead of living in the present.

CONCEPT.name: Quidditch
CONCEPT.description: A popular sport played on broomsticks, involving multiple balls and goals. It represents competition, skill, and teamwork, and it provides a source of camaraderie and rivalry among the characters.

CONCEPT.name: The Forbidden Forest
CONCEPT.description: A dangerous and mysterious forest on the grounds of Hogwarts. It represents the unknown, the untamed, and the potential for danger and discovery.

CONCEPT.name: The Sorting Hat
CONCEPT.description: A magical hat that sorts new students into the four houses of Hogwarts based on their personality traits and values. It represents the importance of belonging and the formation of identity.

CONCEPT.name: Gryffindor, Hufflepuff, Ravenclaw, and Slytherin
CONCEPT.description: The four houses of Hogwarts, each with its own values and history. They represent different aspects of character and personality, and they create a sense of belonging and rivalry among the students.

CONCEPT.name: The Dark Arts
CONCEPT.description: A dangerous and forbidden branch of magic, often associated with evil and power. It represents the temptation of power and the consequences of its misuse.

CONCEPT.name: Voldemort
CONCEPT.description: The main antagonist, a powerful dark wizard who seeks immortality and control. He represents evil, fear, and the dangers of unchecked ambition.

CONCEPT.name: Love
CONCEPT.description: A powerful force that can protect and sustain life. It is a central theme, representing the strength of bonds and the ability to overcome evil.

CONCEPT.name: Friendship
CONCEPT.description: The bond between Harry, Ron, and Hermione, which provides support, courage, and loyalty. It represents the importance of companionship and the power of unity.

CONCEPT.name: Bravery
CONCEPT.description: The courage to face danger and adversity. It is a key value in the story, particularly associated with the Gryffindor house and the actions of the protagonists.

CONCEPT.name: Good vs. Evil
CONCEPT.description: The central conflict of the story, representing the struggle between those who seek to do good and those who embrace darkness. It is a fundamental theme that drives the plot and shapes the characters' choices.

CONCEPT.name: Destiny
CONCEPT.description: The idea that events are predetermined or influenced by fate. It is a recurring theme, particularly in relation to Harry's role in the conflict with Voldemort.

CONCEPT.name: The Elixir of Life
CONCEPT.description: A potion created by the Philosopher's Stone that grants immortality. It represents the human desire to overcome death and the potential consequences of seeking eternal life.

CONCEPT.name: Alchemy
CONCEPT.description: The ancient study of transforming base metals into gold and creating the Elixir of Life. It represents the pursuit of knowledge, the quest for immortality, and the potential for both good and evil.

CHARACTER.name: Harry Potter
CHARACTER.description: An unhappy but ordinary boy who discovers he is a wizard.

CHARACTER.name: Mr Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Director of Grunnings, a big, beefy man with hardly any neck.

CHARACTER.name: Mrs Dursley
CHARACTER.description: Thin and blonde with nearly twice the usual amount of neck.

CHARACTER.name: Dudley Dursley
CHARACTER.description: A fat boy who hates exercise.

TIME_PERIOD.name: 2020s
TIME_PERIOD.description: The time period in which the book is being read, and the generation of readers who will know each other by references to the book.
The year the book was first published.
The year of the Warlocks' Convention, which outlawed dragon-breeding.
The year of a World Cup match in which all seven hundred Quidditch fouls were committed.
The year in which Dumbledore defeated the dark wizard Grindelwald.
